content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 9 to node 2 is:

12 -> 7 -> 4 -> 10

In this path, you start at node 9 and follow the edge to node 12, then follow the edge to node 7, then follow the edge to node 4, and finally follow the edge to node 10. The path ends at node 2.

Note that the graph edges have a direction associated with them, so in the case of this graph, "12 -> 7" means "from node 12 follow edge to node 7", and "4 -> 10" means "from node 4 follow edge to node 10". Therefore, when we go from node 9 to node 2, we have to follow edges in the opposite direction.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 9 is:

7 -> 12 -> 9

In this path, you start at node 2 and follow the edge to node 7, then follow the edge to node 12, and finally follow the edge to node 9. The path ends at node 9.
